#Text=Wikinews interviews Gary Fung from isoHunt
#Text=Thursday , March 9 , 2006

#Text=As reported on Wikinews , isoHunt , a torrent and IRC search site frequented by a massive number of Internet users everyday , has recently been one of the targets of the Motion Picture Association of America 's anti-piracy campaign .
#Text=Originally starting out as an IRC indexing site in January of 2003 , isoHunt added torrent search later that year in July and has been steadily growing since .
#Text=By December , isoHunt had 16,248 torrents available .
#Text=Today that amount is around 250,000 .
#Text=isoHunt has survived while many similar sites around it crumbled , yet was operating long before the others had even been thought of .
#Text=In April of 2005 , isoHunt also gained Torrentbox after its administrator gave it to Gary Fung of isoHunt .
#Text=Wikinews interviewed Mr. Fung , the 22 year-old Canadian administrator of the sites .
#Text=Why did you start your site ?
#Text=For fun , and to learn web programming ( PHP and Mysql ) .
#Text=Also a web search engine for P2P networks has not been done , and would be useful .
#Text=I read on your site at the time , news of the MPAA 's actions hit the news , that you had not been notified , how did you find out ?
#Text=How did you react ?
#Text=I found out first from Mike at Slyck.com , who have received letters of the press release , along with other news outlets like CNET .
#Text=Within a few hours , all the news sites posted about it .
#Text=Do you feel it is appropriate for the MPAA to publicly announce that they have commenced action against your sites and others before you even receive notification ?
#Text=Yes , although not surprising .

#Text=Factually speaking , industry associations like the MPAA often use the threat of pending lawsuits to intimidate to-be defendants , and it serves their purpose of spreading FUD to the public at large .
#Text=Have you ever received a takedown notice from any company in accordance with the DMCA ?
#Text=At least once a day , often many times a day .
#Text=I 've lost count of how many takedown requests we 've received now , it would be at least in the hundreds , if not a thousand .
#Text=We have a thorough copyright policy outlining our stance , compliance and procedures : http://isohunt.com/dmca-copyright.php .
#Text=Some of them come back and actually thank us with satisfaction for our prompt processing .
#Text=For others , such as indie content producers for TV shows and movies , we actually talk to them about using BitTorrent to aid their distribution .
#Text=And such partnerships are in the works .
#Text=How do you go about dealing with them ?
#Text=We verify their authenticity , whether identified works are within their copyright , and disable them if found to be aiding in possible copyright infringement .
#Text=Do you think the service you provide is any different to that of major search engines such as Google and Yahoo ?
#Text=No. We are all search engines , only designed for different markets .
#Text=" Torrents " for example are metadata pointers that describe and link to resources on BitTorrent swarms .
#Text=Google and isoHunt for example are different only in forms of links and types of data they index .
#Text=Both serve the purpose of organizing information on open networks on the internet ( WWW and P2P ) , making them useful and searchable .
#Text=According to the isoHunt website , Gary received official notification of the MPAA 's lawsuit on February 28 , 2006 .
#Text=Gary admits that he was impressed by the amount of research which was put into the suit .
#Text=He said :
#Text=" I have to say I am impressed by the depth of their legal research , evidently their lawyers have been watching us for at least a year , since we exchanged letters last year .
